title: Why is veigar doing this much damage?
body: I was playing nasus and i had 70 percent magic damage reduction and he had only sorcerer shoes for magic pen. He still did 900 damage to me, with just his W. That means his W would have to do almost 3,000 damage. That should not be allowed.

replies.body: _This thread has been archived. Commenting and voting have been disabled._

He probably also has magic pen marks,  and the 7% magic pen mastery. 

Also depends how late the game is - like nasus,  veigar has infinite stacking. Pretty hypocritical to complain about how much damage veigar can stack on a large delay skillshot when nasus can stack just as much on a low cooldown auto attack modifier + reset...

A fed veigar should do loads of damage. He's squishy and immobile,  he really doesn't have much else going for him...

*has a massive AOE stun
nasus can be kited and doesnt have any hard cc. He also doesnt get stacks by just attacking enemy champions

I'm not saying nasus is op or veigar is weak,  just that both have pros and cons:
Veigar is squishy, needs to build damage,  immobile,  has long cooldowns on all but q, has mainly skillshots that can be easily avoided (except r). He also has immense damage potential,  and aoe cc.

Nasus can build pure tank,  is immobile,  has short cooldowns,  has aoe armour/mr shred,  is kite-able, has largely point and click abilities,  and has immense damage potential. 

Realistically,  the only thing veigar has on nasus is range. Which is obviously really valuable.  I'm just saying complaining that veigar can stack oodles of damage while building damage when nasus does the same while building tank,  seems hypocritical to me. 

There's plenty of counterplay to both of them. Dodge his q and he won't stack up.  Dodge his e and he can't land his w. Gank him early and often to snowball your ally since he's immobile.

Deny nasus stacks in Lane.  Gank early and often to shut him down and snowball ally. Make plays around the map while he farms for 5v4 advantages. QSS his wither in the late game. Peel him off your carries.

Veigar also has to build a lot of actual damage items to do real damage late game. Nasus builds almost straight tank and stacks faster to boot.

They stack in different ways and have different pros and cons, it's not really fair to point out one's power without admitting to the other's.

Looked you up quickly.  You had roughly 180 mr - 15 pen from boots and -9 from runes gives us 156 mr.  Thats about 60% dmg reduction. Veigars w does 300 base dmg with an ap ratio of 100%.  That means he would need 2250 total dmg on his w to do 900 dmg to you.  

2250-300=1950

Veigar must have had 1950 ap.  We'll assume max stacks on mejas.

Mejas - 145
Morrelonomicon - 100
Ludens - 100
Rod - 100
Rabadons - 120
= 565 ap
Veigars passive - ?
* 1.35 for rabadons passive
*1.15 for blue buff?
=*1.5

= 1950
/1.5= 1300

1300-565=735

Thus veigars passive must have given him at least 735 ap.  While this is a stretch considering that game was 42 min long its not too impossible, especially in bronze.

Or you could be lying about how much damage it did.  In which case it would have been even easier for him to achieve that result.

Edit: completly forgot about the 7% magic pen mastery but that's irrelevant because veigar had thunderlords.  However I did forget about the 5% boost to dmg to targets below 40% hp and the boost of either 5% for killing enemies or 2.5% for being stunned based on what he took so whoops.
